title: Last activity you solved few questions. In this activity we give you some questions, try to answer those questions
quizDescription: Determine the complexity of the following tasks.

questions.questionText: BSIT staff decide to hold an online chess tournament, and n BSIT students respond to participate in it. If the tournament is a single-elimination tournament (this means you are eliminated when you lose once), how many games do we need to decide the winner, in terms of n? Assume there will be no draws or byes.

options.feedback:
Incorrect
To win, a student will have to play every student on their side and keep winning, eliminating students one at a time, a total of n/2 students.

Correct
To win, a student will have to play every student on their side and keep winning, eliminating students one at a time, a total of n/2 students.

Incorrect
To win, a student will have to play every student on their side and keep winning, eliminating students one at a time, a total of n/2 students.

Incorrect
To win, a student will have to play every student on their side and keep winning, eliminating students one at a time, a total of n/2 students.

Incorrect
To win, a student will have to play every student on their side and keep winning, eliminating students one at a time, a total of n/2 students.

options.option: It depends on how the tournament is organized
options.feedback:
Incorrect
To win, a student will have to play every student on their side and keep winning, eliminating students one at a time, a total of n/2 students.

questions.questionText: You are asked to write an n page research paper. You've written plenty of research papers in your time, and you know it always takes you 30 minutes to write one page of a research paper. In terms of n, what is the complexity order that describes the amount of time this research paper will take to write?

options.feedback:
Incorrect
Each page takes 30 mins to write and there are n pages. The total time is 30n, so an order of n.

Correct
Each page takes 30 mins to write and there are n pages. The total time is 30n, so an order of n.

Incorrect
Each page takes 30 mins to write and there are n pages. The total time is 30n, so an order of n.

Incorrect
Each page takes 30 mins to write and there are n pages. The total time is 30n, so an order of n.

Incorrect
Each page takes 30 mins to write and there are n pages. The total time is 30n, so an order of n.

questions.questionText: You are asked to write an n page personal essay. You've written plenty of personal essays in your time, and you know it always takes you two hours to write a personal essay, no matter the length. In terms of n, what is the complexity order that describes the amount of time this personal essay will take to write?

options.feedback:
Correct
The number of pages you write does not influence how long it takes you to write. The time to write is a constant 2 hours, so order of 1.

Incorrect
The number of pages you write does not influence how long it takes you to write. The time to write is a constant 2 hours, so order of 1.

Incorrect
The number of pages you write does not influence how long it takes you to write. The time to write is a constant 2 hours, so order of 1.

Incorrect
The number of pages you write does not influence how long it takes you to write. The time to write is a constant 2 hours, so order of 1.

Incorrect
The number of pages you write does not influence how long it takes you to write. The time to write is a constant 2 hours, so order of 1.

questions.questionText: You just dropped a box of glass toys and n toys in the box broke in half. You'd like to match the halves of the toys so that you could glue them together, but the only way to tell whether two halves belonged to one toy is to physically pick up the two pieces and try to fit them together. Express how long this matching process will take in terms of n.

options.feedback:
Incorrect
You have to compare every piece with every other piece. If you have 1 toy and it breaks in half, you have 1 comparison to make. If you have 2 toys and they both break in half there are 4 pieces and you have to do 6 comparisons. If you have 3 toys, there are 6 pieces and you have to do 15 comparisons. If you have N/2 toys, you have N pieces and you have to do N-1 + N-2 + N-3 + ... + 1 =(N)(N-1)/2 comparisons. This is O(N^2)

Incorrect
You have to compare every piece with every other piece. If you have 1 toy and it breaks in half, you have 1 comparison to make. If you have 2 toys and they both break in half there are 4 pieces and you have to do 6 comparisons. If you have 3 toys, there are 6 pieces and you have to do 15 comparisons. If you have N/2 toys, you have N pieces and you have to do N-1 + N-2 + N-3 + ... + 1 =(N)(N-1)/2 comparisons. This is O(N^2)

Correct
You have to compare every piece with every other piece. If you have 1 toy and it breaks in half, you have 1 comparison to make. If you have 2 toys and they both break in half there are 4 pieces and you have to do 6 comparisons. If you have 3 toys, there are 6 pieces and you have to do 15 comparisons. If you have N/2 toys, you have N pieces and you have to do N-1 + N-2 + N-3 + ... + 1 =(N)(N-1)/2 comparisons. This is O(N^2)

Incorrect
You have to compare every piece with every other piece. If you have 1 toy and it breaks in half, you have 1 comparison to make. If you have 2 toys and they both break in half there are 4 pieces and you have to do 6 comparisons. If you have 3 toys, there are 6 pieces and you have to do 15 comparisons. If you have N/2 toys, you have N pieces and you have to do N-1 + N-2 + N-3 + ... + 1 =(N)(N-1)/2 comparisons. This is O(N^2)

Incorrect
You have to compare every piece with every other piece. If you have 1 toy and it breaks in half, you have 1 comparison to make. If you have 2 toys and they both break in half there are 4 pieces and you have to do 6 comparisons. If you have 3 toys, there are 6 pieces and you have to do 15 comparisons. If you have N/2 toys, you have N pieces and you have to do N-1 + N-2 + N-3 + ... + 1 =(N)(N-1)/2 comparisons. This is O(N^2)
